text: #SuperTyphoonYutu A reminder for everyone in the Marianas to please remain indoors and stay away from windows. Although the worst of the typhoon has passed, it is still not safe for anyone to go outside.
label: D

text: #SuperTyphoonYutu All ports are closed. Over 20 flights into the Northern Marianas have been cancelled. The Commonwealth Office of Transit Authority has temporarily ceased emergency evacuation transport services to Saipan shelters for safety reasons.
label: D

text: #SuperTyphoonYutu The Tinian Medical Center sustained extensive damage. Fortunately no patients were present. CHC and Rota Medical Center are running on generator power.
label: D

text: #SuperTyphoonYutu 13 shelters are open with one more location on standby. Saipan has 10 shelters open; six are full. Tinian has one shelter; Rota has two. FEMA has 10 days of food and water on hand for those in need. Cots, blankets, tents, toilet kits, and tarps also available.
label: D

text: Nearly 200 FEMA and other federal agency personnel are in the Marianas ready to assist CNMI in typhoon recovery. #SuperTyphoonYutu
label: D

text:
FEMA wants to remind us to not venture outside until told that it is safe to do so by local officials.

In the current weather conditions, it isn‚Äôt safe. If you must leave your home due to a life-threatening situation, your best option is to go to your closest fire station.
label: D

text:
Typhoon Condition 1 remains in effect for Saipan, Tinian and Rota. Tropical Storm Condition 1 is in effect for Alamagan, Pagan and Agrihan.

Typhoon conditions expected to persist through the evening into late Thursday morning.
